lead_paragraph: HOROWITZ--Renata Gross, age 21, died April 9 of injuries sustained in an accident on a road trip to South Dakota. Deeply beloved daughter of Amie Gross and Harold Horowitz and cherished stepdaughter of Susan Epstein, adored sister of Azra Horowitz and Alison Epstein and stepsister of Lauren Binet and step granddaughter of Harold Epstein and devoted niece of Ellen Gross, Richard Horowitz, Marjorie and Tony Schultz, Rachel and Bill Breitbart, Larry and Liz Epstein and Mike and Peggy Epstein as well as ringleader to a dozen cousins. Her 21 years were well-lived surrounded by a wide circle of friends. A brilliant student, committed activist, talented dancer and filmmaker, Renny was a graduate of Stuyvesant High School and a member of the University of Chicago Class of 2016. She was a voracious reader and traveler who visited six continents documenting her trips with photos and films. We will miss her raucous laugh, robust debates, and vivid presence. Contributions in her memory may be made to the LifeSource Organ and Tissue Donations, Memories of Blacks in Ballet (MOBBBallet.org), or Lawyers for Children. Services will be held Tuesday, April 12. Please visit www.newshul.org for further information. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  HOROWITZ, RENATA GROSS
